C I R C U L A R  12/ 2006 
 
1. 
Each  airport  operator shall establish, implement and maintain a written  
airport operator security programme which  meets the requirements of the 
national civil aviation security programme of the country:  
 
 All  security  procedures   at the airport  shall be  followed  in accordance   with 
the  approved  airport  security  programme  of  that  airport. 
 
2. 
The format prescribed by ICAO vide Appendix 9 of ICAO Security Manual 
shall be utilized  by the airport  operators for preparing their security 
programmes. 
 
3. 
The airport  operators,  who are already  serving  civil aviation  at  
respective  airports  in the country and have not yet submitted their security 
programmes shall submit their programme to the BCAS  HQrs. through  
respective  Regional Dy Commissioners  of  Security (CA), BCAS and get the 
same approved within three months time from issue of this Circular positively. 
 
4. 
The Airport Security Programme shall be valid for a period of  5 years. 
However, the security programme shall be updated by the concerned  airport 
operators on the basis of security directives issued by the BCAS from time to 
time. After 5 years, a revised  airport security programme in respect of each 
airport  shall be submitted by  concerned airport  operator  as mentioned in para 
2 above to the BCAS for approval of  COSCA.  
 
5. 
The  airport security programme shall be produced by the concerned 
airport operator to the BCAS officer during audit/ inspection.  
 
6. 
No airport operator shall be allowed to commission civil aviation 
operations  from any  new airport in India unless the airport security programme 
is approved by the Commissioner of Security(CA). 
 
7. 
The above instructions shall come into force with immediate effect, and 
will remain so till further orders.
